member.summary: Sets the SigKneesOnset setting for this . amount of time not taking a step.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotHeadLookHelper.#ctor(CitizenFX.Core.Ped)
member.summary: Creates a new Instance of the ShotHeadLookHelper for sending a ShotHeadLook to a given .
member.param: The to send the ShotHeadLook to.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotHeadLookHelper.UseHeadLook
member.summary: Sets the UseHeadLook setting for this . Use headLook. Default: looks at provided target or if this is zero - looks forward or in velocity direction. If reachForWound is enabled, switches between looking at the wound and at the default target.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotHeadLookHelper.HeadLook
member.summary: Sets the HeadLook setting for this . position to look at with headlook flag.
member.remarks: Default value = Vector3(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f).

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotHeadLookHelper.HeadLookAtWoundMinTimer
member.summary: Sets the HeadLookAtWoundMinTimer setting for this . Min time to look at wound.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotHeadLookHelper.HeadLookAtWoundMaxTimer
member.summary: Sets the HeadLookAtWoundMaxTimer setting for this . Max time to look at wound.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.8f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotHeadLookHelper.HeadLookAtHeadPosMaxTimer
member.summary: Sets the HeadLookAtHeadPosMaxTimer setting for this . Min time to look headLook or if zero - forward or in velocity direction.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.7f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotHeadLookHelper.HeadLookAtHeadPosMinTimer
member.summary: Sets the HeadLookAtHeadPosMinTimer setting for this . Max time to look headLook or if zero - forward or in velocity direction.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: T:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper
member.summary: configure the arm reactions in shot.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.#ctor(CitizenFX.Core.Ped)
member.summary: Creates a new Instance of the ShotConfigureArmsHelper for sending a ShotConfigureArms to a given .
member.param: The to send the ShotConfigureArms to.
member.remarks: configure the arm reactions in shot.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Brace
member.summary: Sets the Brace setting for this . blind brace with arms if appropriate.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.PointGun
member.summary: Sets the PointGun setting for this . Point gun if appropriate.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.UseArmsWindmill
member.summary: Sets the UseArmsWindmill setting for this . armsWindmill if going backwards fast enough.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReleaseWound
member.summary: Sets the ReleaseWound setting for this . release wound if going sideways/forward fast enough. 0 = don't. 1 = only if bracing. 2 = any default arm reaction.
member.remarks: Default value = 1. Min value = 0. Max value = 2.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReachFalling
member.summary: Sets the ReachFalling setting for this . reachForWound when falling 0 = false, 1 = true, 2 = once per shot performance.
member.remarks: Default value = 0. Min value = 0. Max value = 2.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReachFallingWithOneHand
member.summary: Sets the ReachFallingWithOneHand setting for this . Force character to reach for wound with only one hand when falling or fallen. 0= allow 2 handed reach, 1= left only if 2 handed possible, 2= right only if 2 handed possible, 3 = one handed but automatic (allows switching of hands).
member.remarks: Default value = 3. Min value = 0. Max value = 3.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReachOnFloor
member.summary: Sets the ReachOnFloor setting for this . reachForWound when on floor - 0 = false, 1 = true, 2 = once per shot performance.
member.remarks: Default value = 0. Min value = 0. Max value = 2.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AlwaysReachTime
member.summary: Sets the AlwaysReachTime setting for this . Inhibit arms brace for this amount of time after reachForWound has begun.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AWSpeedMult
member.summary: Sets the AWSpeedMult setting for this . For armsWindmill, multiplier on character speed - increase of speed of circling is proportional to character speed (max speed of circliing increase = 1.5). eg. lowering the value increases the range of velocity that the 0-1.5 is applied over.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AWRadiusMult
member.summary: Sets the AWRadiusMult setting for this . For armsWindmill, multiplier on character speed - increase of radii is proportional to character speed (max radius increase = 0.45). eg. lowering the value increases the range of velocity that the 0-0.45 is applied over.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AWStiffnessAdd
member.summary: Sets the AWStiffnessAdd setting for this . For armsWindmill, added arm stiffness ranges from 0 to AWStiffnessAdd.
member.remarks: Default value = 4.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReachWithOneHand
member.summary: Sets the ReachWithOneHand setting for this . Force character to reach for wound with only one hand. 0= allow 2 handed reach, 1= left only if 2 handed possible, 2= right only if 2 handed possible.
member.remarks: Default value = 0. Min value = 0. Max value = 2.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AllowLeftPistolRFW
member.summary: Sets the AllowLeftPistolRFW setting for this . Allow character to reach for wound with left hand if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle. If pointGun is running this will only happen if the hand cannot point and pointGun:poseUnusedGunArm = false.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AllowRightPistolRFW
member.summary: Sets the AllowRightPistolRFW setting for this . Allow character to reach for wound with right hand if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle. If pointGun is running this will only happen if the hand cannot point and pointGun:poseUnusedGunArm = false.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.RfwWithPistol
member.summary: Sets the RfwWithPistol setting for this . Override pointGun and reachForWound if desired if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2
member.summary: Sets the Fling2 setting for this . Type of reaction.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2Left
member.summary: Sets the Fling2Left setting for this . Fling the left arm.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2Right
member.summary: Sets the Fling2Right setting for this . Fling the right arm.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2OverrideStagger
member.summary: Sets the Fling2OverrideStagger setting for this . Override stagger arms even if staggerFall:m_upperBodyReaction = true.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2TimeBefore
member.summary: Sets the Fling2TimeBefore setting for this . Time after hit that the fling will start (allows for a bit of loose arm movement from bullet impact.snap etc).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2Time
member.summary: Sets the Fling2Time setting for this . Duration of the fling behaviour.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2MStiffL
member.summary: Sets the Fling2MStiffL setting for this . MuscleStiffness of the left arm. If negative then uses the shots underlying muscle stiffness from controlStiffness (i.e. respects looseness).
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.5f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2MStiffR
member.summary: Sets the Fling2MStiffR setting for this . MuscleStiffness of the right arm. If negative then uses the shots underlying muscle stiffness from controlStiffness (i.e. respects looseness).
member.remarks: Default value = -1.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.5f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2RelaxTimeL
member.summary: Sets the Fling2RelaxTimeL setting for this . Maximum time before the left arm relaxes in the fling. It will relax automatically when the arm has completed it's bent arm fling. This is what causes the arm to straighten.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2RelaxTimeR
member.summary: Sets the Fling2RelaxTimeR setting for this . Maximum time before the right arm relaxes in the fling. It will relax automatically when the arm has completed it's bent arm fling. This is what causes the arm to straighten.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2AngleMinL
member.summary: Sets the Fling2AngleMinL setting for this . Min fling angle for left arm. Fling angle is random in the range fling2AngleMin:fling2AngleMax. Angle of fling in radians measured from the body horizontal sideways from shoulder. positive is up, 0 shoulder level, negative down.
member.remarks: Default value = -1.5f. Min value = -1.5f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2AngleMaxL
member.summary: Sets the Fling2AngleMaxL setting for this . Max fling angle for left arm.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = -1.5f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2AngleMinR
member.summary: Sets the Fling2AngleMinR setting for this . Min fling angle for right arm.
member.remarks: Default value = -1.5f. Min value = -1.5f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2AngleMaxR
member.summary: Sets the Fling2AngleMaxR setting for this . Max fling angle for right arm.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = -1.5f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2LengthMinL
member.summary: Sets the Fling2LengthMinL setting for this . Min left arm length. Armlength is random in the range fling2LengthMin:fling2LengthMax. Armlength maps one to one with elbow angle. (These values are scaled internally for the female character).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.3f. Max value = 0.6f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2LengthMaxL
member.summary: Sets the Fling2LengthMaxL setting for this . Max left arm length.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = 0.3f. Max value = 0.6f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2LengthMinR
member.summary: Sets the Fling2LengthMinR setting for this . Min right arm length.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.3f. Max value = 0.6f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2LengthMaxR
member.summary: Sets the Fling2LengthMaxR setting for this . Max right arm length.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = 0.3f. Max value = 0.6f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Bust
member.summary: Sets the Bust setting for this . Has the character got a bust. If so then cupBust (move bust reach targets below bust) or bustElbowLift and cupSize (stop upperArm penetrating bust and move bust targets to surface of bust) are implemented.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.BustElbowLift
member.summary: Sets the BustElbowLift setting for this . Lift the elbows up this much extra to avoid upper arm penetrating the bust (when target hits spine2 or spine3).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.7f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.CupSize
member.summary: Sets the CupSize setting for this . Amount reach target to bust (spine2) will be offset forward by.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.CupBust
member.summary: Sets the CupBust setting for this . All reach targets above or on the bust will cause a reach below the bust. (specifically moves spine3 and spine2 targets to spine1). bustElbowLift and cupSize are ignored.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: T:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper
member.summary: Clone of High Fall with a wider range of operating conditions.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.#ctor(CitizenFX.Core.Ped)
member.summary: Creates a new Instance of the SmartFallHelper for sending a SmartFall to a given .
member.param: The to send the SmartFall to.
member.remarks: Clone of High Fall with a wider range of operating conditions.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.BodyStiffness
member.summary: Sets the BodyStiffness setting for this . stiffness of body. Value feeds through to bodyBalance (synched with defaults), to armsWindmill (14 for this value at default ), legs pedal, head look and roll down stairs directly.
member.remarks: Default value = 11.0f. Min value = 6.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Bodydamping
member.summary: Sets the Bodydamping setting for this . The damping of the joints.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 3.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Catchfalltime
member.summary: Sets the Catchfalltime setting for this . The length of time before the impact that the character transitions to the landing.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.CrashOrLandCutOff
member.summary: Sets the CrashOrLandCutOff setting for this . 0.52angle is 0.868 dot//A threshold for deciding how far away from upright the character needs to be before bailing out (going into a foetal) instead of trying to land (keeping stretched out). NB: never does bailout if ignorWorldCollisions true.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.9f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.PdStrength
member.summary: Sets the PdStrength setting for this . Strength of the controller to keep the character at angle aimAngleBase from vertical.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.PdDamping
member.summary: Sets the PdDamping setting for this . Damping multiplier of the controller to keep the character at angle aimAngleBase from vertical. The actual damping is pdDamping*pdStrength*constant*angVel.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 5.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmAngSpeed
member.summary: Sets the ArmAngSpeed setting for this . arm circling speed in armWindMillAdaptive.
member.remarks: Default value = 7.9f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 20.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmAmplitude
member.summary: Sets the ArmAmplitude setting for this . in armWindMillAdaptive.
member.remarks: Default value = 2.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmPhase
member.summary: Sets the ArmPhase setting for this . in armWindMillAdaptive 3.1 opposite for stuntman. 1.0 old default. 0.0 in phase.
member.remarks: Default value = 3.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 6.3f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmBendElbows
member.summary: Sets the ArmBendElbows setting for this . in armWindMillAdaptive bend the elbows as a function of armAngle. For stuntman true otherwise false.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegRadius
member.summary: Sets the LegRadius setting for this . radius of legs on pedal.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.4f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 0.5f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegAngSpeed
member.summary: Sets the LegAngSpeed setting for this . in pedal.
member.remarks: Default value = 7.9f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 15.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegAsymmetry
member.summary: Sets the LegAsymmetry setting for this . 0.0 for stuntman. Random offset applied per leg to the angular speed to desynchronise the pedaling - set to 0 to disable, otherwise should be set to less than the angularSpeed value.
member.remarks: Default value = 4.0f. Min value = -10.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Arms2LegsPhase
member.summary: Sets the Arms2LegsPhase setting for this . phase angle between the arms and legs circling angle.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 6.5f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Arms2LegsSync
member.summary: Sets the Arms2LegsSync setting for this . Syncs the arms angle to what the leg angle is.
member.remarks: Default value = . All speed/direction parameters of armswindmill are overwritten if = . If and you want synced arms/legs then armAngSpeed=legAngSpeed, legAsymmetry = 0.0 (to stop randomizations of the leg cicle speed).

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmsUp
member.summary: Sets the ArmsUp setting for this . Where to put the arms when preparing to land. Approx 1 = above head, 0 = head height, -1 = down. LT -2.0 use catchFall arms, LT -3.0 use prepare for landing pose if Agent is due to land vertically, feet first.
member.remarks: Default value = -3.1f. Min value = -4.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.OrientateBodyToFallDirection
member.summary: Sets the OrientateBodyToFallDirection setting for this . toggle to orientate to fall direction. i.e. orientate so that the character faces the horizontal velocity direction.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.OrientateTwist
member.summary: Sets the OrientateTwist setting for this . If false don't worry about the twist angle of the character when orientating the character. If false this allows the twist axis of the character to be free (You can get a nice twisting highFall like the one in dieHard 4 when the car goes into the helicopter).
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.OrientateMax
member.summary: Sets the OrientateMax setting for this . DEVEL parameter - suggest you don't edit it. Maximum torque the orientation controller can apply. If 0 then no helper torques will be used. 300 will orientate the character soflty for all but extreme angles away from aimAngleBase. If abs (current -aimAngleBase) is getting near 3.0 then this can be reduced to give a softer feel.
member.remarks: Default value = 300.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2000.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.AlanRickman
member.summary: Sets the AlanRickman setting for this . If true then orientate the character to face the point from where it started falling. HighFall like the one in dieHard with Alan Rickman.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.FowardRoll
member.summary: Sets the FowardRoll setting for this . Try to execute a forward Roll on landing.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.UseZeroPose_withFowardRoll
member.summary: Sets the UseZeroPose_withFowardRoll setting for this . Blend to a zero pose when forward roll is attempted.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.AimAngleBase
member.summary: Sets the AimAngleBase setting for this . Angle from vertical the pdController is driving to ( positive = forwards).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.2f. Min value = -3.1f. Max value = 3.1f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.FowardVelRotation
member.summary: Sets the FowardVelRotation setting for this . scale to add/subtract from aimAngle based on forward speed (Internal).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.FootVelCompScale
member.summary: Sets the FootVelCompScale setting for this . Scale to change to amount of vel that is added to the foot ik from the velocity (Internal).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.SideD
member.summary: Sets the SideD setting for this . sideoffset for the feet during prepareForLanding. +ve = right.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.2f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.FowardOffsetOfLegIK
member.summary: Sets the FowardOffsetOfLegIK setting for this . Forward offset for the feet during prepareForLanding.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegL
member.summary: Sets the LegL setting for this . Leg Length for ik (Internal)//unused.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.CatchFallCutOff
member.summary: Sets the CatchFallCutOff setting for this . 0.5angle is 0.878 dot. Cutoff to go to the catchFall ( internal) //mmmtodo do like crashOrLandCutOff.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.9f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegStrength
member.summary: Sets the LegStrength setting for this . Strength of the legs at landing.
member.remarks: Default value = 12.0f. Min value = 6.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Balance
member.summary: Sets the Balance setting for this . If true have enough strength to balance. If false not enough strength in legs to balance (even though bodyBlance called).
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.IgnorWorldCollisions
member.summary: Sets the IgnorWorldCollisions setting for this . Never go into bailout (foetal).
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.AdaptiveCircling
member.summary: Sets the AdaptiveCircling setting for this . stuntman type fall. Arm and legs circling direction controlled by angmom and orientation.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Hula
member.summary: Sets the Hula setting for this . With stuntman type fall. Hula reaction if can't see floor and not rotating fast.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.MaxSpeedForRecoverableFall
member.summary: Sets the MaxSpeedForRecoverableFall setting for this . Character needs to be moving less than this speed to consider fall as a recoverable one.
member.remarks: Default value = 15.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.MinSpeedForBrace
member.summary: Sets the MinSpeedForBrace setting for this . Character needs to be moving at least this fast horizontally to start bracing for impact if there is an object along its trajectory.
member.remarks: Default value = 10.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LandingNormal
member.summary: Sets the LandingNormal setting for this . Ray-cast normal doted with up direction has to be greater than this number to consider object flat enough to land on it.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsForceMag
member.summary: Sets the RdsForceMag setting for this .
member.remarks: Default value = 0.8f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsTargetLinVeDecayTime
member.summary: Sets the RdsTargetLinVeDecayTime setting for this . RDS: Time for the targetlinearVelocity to decay to zero.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsTargetLinearVelocity
member.summary: Sets the RdsTargetLinearVelocity setting for this . RDS: Helper torques are applied to match the spin of the character to the max of targetLinearVelocity and COMVelMag. -1 to use initial character velocity.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 30.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsUseStartingFriction
member.summary: Sets the RdsUseStartingFriction setting for this . Start Catch Fall/RDS state with specified friction. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsStartingFriction
member.summary: Sets the RdsStartingFriction setting for this . Catch Fall/RDS starting friction. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsStartingFrictionMin
member.summary: Sets the RdsStartingFrictionMin setting for this . Catch Fall/RDS starting friction minimum. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsForceVelThreshold
member.summary: Sets the RdsForceVelThreshold setting for this . Velocity threshold under which RDS force mag will be applied.
member.remarks: Default value = 10.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.InitialState
member.summary: Sets the InitialState setting for this . Force initial state (used in vehicle bail out to start SF_CatchFall (6) earlier.
member.remarks: Default value = 0. Min value = 0. Max value = 7.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ChangeExtremityFriction
member.summary: Sets the ChangeExtremityFriction setting for this . Allow friction changes to be applied to the hands and feet.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Teeter
member.summary: Sets the Teeter setting for this . Set up an immediate teeter in the direction of trave if initial state is SF_Balance.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.TeeterOffset
member.summary: Sets the TeeterOffset setting for this . Offset the default Teeter edge in the direction of travel. Will need to be tweaked depending on how close to the real edge AI tends to trigger the behaviour.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.StopRollingTime
member.summary: Sets the StopRollingTime setting for this . Time in seconds before ped should start actively trying to stop rolling.
member.remarks: Default value = 2.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ReboundScale
member.summary: Sets the ReboundScale setting for this . Scale for rebound assistance. 0=off, 1=very bouncy, 2=jbone crazy Try 0.5?.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ReboundMask
member.summary: Sets the ReboundMask setting for this . Part mask to apply rebound assistance.
member.remarks: Default value = uk.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ForceHeadAvoid
member.summary: Sets the ForceHeadAvoid setting for this . Force head avoid to be active during Catch Fall even when character is not on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.CfZAxisSpinReduction
member.summary: Sets the CfZAxisSpinReduction setting for this . Pass-through parameter for Catch Fall spin reduction. Increase to stop more spin. 0..1.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.SplatWhenStopped
member.summary: Sets the SplatWhenStopped setting for this . Transition to splat state when com vel is below value, regardless of character health or fall velocity. Set to zero to disable.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.BlendHeadWhenStopped
member.summary: Sets the BlendHeadWhenStopped setting for this . Blend head to neutral pose com vel approaches zero. Linear between zero and value. Set to zero to disable.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.SpreadLegs
member.summary: Sets the SpreadLegs setting for this . Spread legs amount for Pedal during fall.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.summary: Sets the TimeAtStartValues setting for this . time spent with Start values for arms and spine stiffness and damping ie for whiplash efffect.

member.summary: Sets the StaggerStepProb setting for this . Probability per step of time spent in a stagger step.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.StepsTillStartEnd
member.summary: Sets the StepsTillStartEnd setting for this . steps taken before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down by perStepReduction1.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.TimeStartEnd
member.summary: Sets the TimeStartEnd setting for this . time from start of behaviour before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down for rampTimeToEndValues to endValues.
member.remarks: Default value = 100.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.RampTimeToEndValues
member.summary: Sets the RampTimeToEndValues setting for this . time spent ramping from lowerBodyStiffness to lowerBodyStiffnessEnd.

member.summary: Sets the LowerBodyStiffness setting for this . lowerBodyStiffness should be 12.

member.summary: Sets the LowerBodyStiffnessEnd setting for this . lowerBodyStiffness at end.
member.remarks: Default value = 8.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.PredictionTime
member.summary: Sets the PredictionTime setting for this . amount of time (seconds) into the future that the character tries to step to. bigger values try to recover with fewer, bigger steps. smaller values recover with smaller steps, and generally recover less.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.summary: Sets the PerStepReduction1 setting for this . LowerBody stiffness will be reduced every step to make the character fallover.

member.summary: Sets the Lean2multF setting for this . Lean of spine to side in side velocity direction when going forwards.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.PushOffDist
member.summary: Sets the PushOffDist setting for this . amount stance foot is behind com in the direction of velocity before the leg tries to pushOff to increase momentum. Increase to lower the probability of the pushOff making the character bouncy.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.2f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.MaxPushoffVel
member.summary: Sets the MaxPushoffVel setting for this . stance leg will only pushOff to increase momentum if the vertical hip velocity is less than this value. 0.4 seems like a good value. The higher it is the the less this functionality is applied. If it is very low or negative this can stop the pushOff altogether.
member.remarks: Default value = 20.0f. Min value = -20.0f. Max value = 20.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.HipBendMult
member.summary: Sets the HipBendMult setting for this . hipBend scaled with velocity.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = -10.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.AlwaysBendForwards
member.summary: Sets the AlwaysBendForwards setting for this . bend forwards at the hip (hipBendMult) whether moving backwards or forwards.

member.summary: Sets the SpineBendMult setting for this . spine bend scaled with velocity.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.4f. Min value = -10.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.SpineDampingStart
member.summary: Sets the SpineDampingStart setting for this . spineDamping during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.SpineStiffnessStart
member.summary: Sets the SpineStiffnessStart setting for this . spineStiffness during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues.
member.remarks: Default value = 3.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.TimeAtStartValues
member.summary: Sets the TimeAtStartValues setting for this . time spent with Start values for arms and spine stiffness and damping ie for whiplash efffect.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.4f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.RampTimeFromStartValues
member.summary: Sets the RampTimeFromStartValues setting for this . time spent ramping from Start to end values for arms and spine stiffness and damping ie for whiplash efffect (occurs after timeAtStartValues).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.StepsTillStartEnd
member.summary: Sets the StepsTillStartEnd setting for this . steps taken before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down.
member.remarks: Default value = 2. Min value = 0. Max value = 100.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.TimeStartEnd
member.summary: Sets the TimeStartEnd setting for this . time from start of behaviour before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down by perStepReduction1.
member.remarks: Default value = 100.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.RampTimeToEndValues
member.summary: Sets the RampTimeToEndValues setting for this . time spent ramping from lowerBodyStiffness to lowerBodyStiffnessEnd.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.LowerBodyStiffness
member.summary: Sets the LowerBodyStiffness setting for this . lowerBodyStiffness should be 12.
member.remarks: Default value = 12.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.LowerBodyStiffnessEnd
member.summary: Sets the LowerBodyStiffnessEnd setting for this . lowerBodyStiffness at end.
member.remarks: Default value = 8.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.PerStepReduction
member.summary: Sets the PerStepReduction setting for this . LowerBody stiffness will be reduced every step to make the character fallover.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HipPitchForward
member.summary: Sets the HipPitchForward setting for this . Amount to bend forward at the hips (+ve forward, -ve backwards). Behaviour switches between hipPitchForward and hipPitchBack.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = -1.3f. Max value = 1.3f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HipPitchBack
member.summary: Sets the HipPitchBack setting for this . Amount to bend backwards at the hips (+ve backwards, -ve forwards). Behaviour switches between hipPitchForward and hipPitchBack.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = -1.3f. Max value = 1.3f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.SpineBend
member.summary: Sets the SpineBend setting for this . Bend/Twist the spine amount.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.7f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.FootFriction
member.summary: Sets the FootFriction setting for this . Foot friction when standing/stepping. 0.5 gives a good slide sometimes.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.TurnThresholdMin
member.summary: Sets the TurnThresholdMin setting for this . min angle at which the turn with toggle to the other direction (actual toggle angle is chosen randomly in range min to max). If it is 1 then it will never toggle. If negative then no turn is applied.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = -0.1f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.TurnThresholdMax
member.summary: Sets the TurnThresholdMax setting for this . max angle at which the turn with toggle to the other direction (actual toggle angle is chosen randomly in range min to max). If it is 1 then it will never toggle. If negative then no turn is applied.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = -0.1f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.UseHeadLook
member.summary: Sets the UseHeadLook setting for this . enable and provide a look-at target to make the character's head turn to face it while balancing.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HeadLookPos
member.summary: Sets the HeadLookPos setting for this . position of thing to look at.
member.remarks: Default value = Vector3(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f).

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HeadLookInstanceIndex
member.summary: Sets the HeadLookInstanceIndex setting for this . level index of thing to look at.
member.remarks: Default value = -1. Min value = -1.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HeadLookAtVelProb
member.summary: Sets the HeadLookAtVelProb setting for this . Probability [0-1] that headLook will be looking in the direction of velocity when stepping.
member.remarks: Default value = -1.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.ComVelRDSThresh
member.summary: Sets the ComVelRDSThresh setting for this . for handsAndKnees catchfall ONLY: comVel above which rollDownstairs will start.
member.remarks: Default value = 2.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 20.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HulaPeriod
member.summary: Sets the HulaPeriod setting for this . 0.25 A complete wiggle will take 4*hulaPeriod.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HipAmplitude
member.summary: Sets the HipAmplitude setting for this . Amount of hip movement.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 4.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.SpineAmplitude
member.summary: Sets the SpineAmplitude setting for this . Amount of spine movement.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 4.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.MinRelaxPeriod
member.summary: Sets the MinRelaxPeriod setting for this . wriggle relaxes for a minimum of minRelaxPeriod (if it is negative it is a multiplier on the time previously spent wriggling).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = -5.0f. Max value = 5.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.MaxRelaxPeriod
member.summary: Sets the MaxRelaxPeriod setting for this . wriggle relaxes for a maximum of maxRelaxPeriod (if it is negative it is a multiplier on the time previously spent wriggling).
member.remarks: Default value = 1.5f. Min value = -5.0f. Max value = 5.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.RollHelp
member.summary: Sets the RollHelp setting for this . Amount of cheat torque applied to turn the character over.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundLegStiffness
member.summary: Sets the GroundLegStiffness setting for this . Leg Stiffness when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 11.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundArmStiffness
member.summary: Sets the GroundArmStiffness setting for this . Arm Stiffness when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 11.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundSpineStiffness
member.summary: Sets the GroundSpineStiffness setting for this . Spine Stiffness when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 14.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundLegDamping
member.summary: Sets the GroundLegDamping setting for this . Leg Damping when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundArmDamping
member.summary: Sets the GroundArmDamping setting for this . Arm Damping when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundSpineDamping
member.summary: Sets the GroundSpineDamping setting for this . Spine Damping when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:CitizenFX.Core.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundFriction
member.summary: Sets the GroundFriction setting for this . Friction multiplier on bodyParts when on ground. Character can look too slidy with groundFriction = 1. Higher values give a more jerky reation but this seems timestep dependent especially for dragged by the feet.
member.remarks: Default value = 8.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: T:CitizenFX.Core.FastStructure`1
member.summary:
Emits optimized IL for the reading and writing of structures to/from memory.
For a 32-byte structure with 1 million iterations:
The method performs approx. 20x faster than (8ms vs 160ms), and about 1.6x slower than the non-generic equivalent (8ms vs 5ms)
The method performs approx. 8x faster than (4ms vs 34ms).

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthogonalize
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified matrix.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the matrix will be orthogonal to any other given row in the matrix.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthonormalize
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified matrix.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@)
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified matrix.
member.param: The matrix to orthogonalize.
When the method completes, contains the orthogonalized matrix.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the matrix will be orthogonal to any other given row in the matrix.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix)
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified matrix.
member.param: The matrix to orthogonalize.
member.returns: The orthogonalized matrix.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the matrix will be orthogonal to any other given row in the matrix.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@)
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified matrix.
member.param: The matrix to orthonormalize.
When the method completes, contains the orthonormalized matrix.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix)
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified matrix.
member.param: The matrix to orthonormalize.
member.returns: The orthonormalized matrix.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.UpperTriangularForm(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@)
member.summary: Brings the matrix into upper triangular form using elementary row operations.
member.param: The matrix to put into upper triangular form.
When the method completes, contains the upper triangular matrix.
member.remarks: If the matrix is not invertible (i.e. its determinant is zero) than the result of this method may produce Single.Nan and Single.Inf values. When the matrix represents a system of linear equations, than this often means that either no solution exists or an infinite number of solutions exist.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.UpperTriangularForm(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix)

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.ReducedRowEchelonForm(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector4@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector4@)
member.summary: Brings the matrix into reduced row echelon form using elementary row operations.
member.param: The matrix to put into reduced row echelon form.
The fifth column of the matrix.
When the method completes, contains the resultant matrix after the operation.
When the method completes, contains the resultant fifth column of the matrix.

remarks.para: The fifth column is often called the augmented part of the matrix. This is because the fifth column is really just an extension of the matrix so that there is a place to put all of the non-zero components after the operation is complete.
Often times the resultant matrix will the identity matrix or a matrix similar to the identity matrix. Sometimes, however, that is not possible and numbers other than zero and one may appear.

This method can be used to solve systems of linear equations. Upon completion of this method, the will contain the solution for the system. It is up to the user to analyze both the input and the result to determine if a solution really exists.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthogonalize
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the Matrix3x3 will be orthogonal to any other given row in the Matrix3x3.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthonormalize
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@)
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified Matrix3x3.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to orthogonalize.
When the method completes, contains the orthogonalized Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the Matrix3x3 will be orthogonal to any other given row in the Matrix3x3.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3)
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified Matrix3x3.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to orthogonalize.
member.returns: The orthogonalized Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the Matrix3x3 will be orthogonal to any other given row in the Matrix3x3.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@)
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified Matrix3x3.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to orthonormalize.
When the method completes, contains the orthonormalized Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3)
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified Matrix3x3.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to orthonormalize.
member.returns: The orthonormalized Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.UpperTriangularForm(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@)
member.summary: Brings the Matrix3x3 into upper triangular form using elementary row operations.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to put into upper triangular form.
When the method completes, contains the upper triangular Matrix3x3.
member.remarks: If the Matrix3x3 is not invertible (i.e. its determinant is zero) than the result of this method may produce Single.Nan and Single.Inf values. When the Matrix3x3 represents a system of linear equations, than this often means that either no solution exists or an infinite number of solutions exist.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector
When the method completes, contains the squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector2[])
member.summary: Orthogonalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthogonalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthogonalize.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other. This means that any given vector in the list will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector2[])
member.summary: Orthonormalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthonormalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthonormalize.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other and making all vectors of unit length. This means that any given vector will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.TransformCoordinate(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.param: The coordinate vector to transform.
The transformation .
When the method completes, contains the transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.TransformNormal(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@)
member.summary: Performs a normal transformation using the given .
member.param: The normal vector to transform.
The transformation .
When the method completes, contains the transformed normal.
member.remarks: A normal transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is zero. This causes the fourth row and fourth column of the matrix to be unused. The end result is a vector that is not translated, but all other transformation properties apply. This is often preferred for normal vectors as normals purely represent direction rather than location because normal vectors should not be translated.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
When the method completes, contains the squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3,CitizenFX.Core.Vector3)

For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector3[])
member.summary: Orthogonalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthogonalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthogonalize.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other. This means that any given vector in the list will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector3[])
member.summary: Orthonormalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthonormalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthonormalize.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other and making all vectors of unit length. This means that any given vector will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.TransformCoordinate(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.param: The coordinate vector to transform.
The transformation .
When the method completes, contains the transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.TransformNormal(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@)
member.summary: Performs a normal transformation using the given .
member.param: The normal vector to transform.
The transformation .
When the method completes, contains the transformed normal.
member.remarks: A normal transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is zero. This causes the fourth row and fourth column of the matrix to be unused. The end result is a vector that is not translated, but all other transformation properties apply. This is often preferred for normal vectors as normals purely represent direction rather than location because normal vectors should not be translated.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector4.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector4@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector4@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
When the method completes, contains the squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector4.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector4,CitizenFX.Core.Vector4)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.

member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector4.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector4[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector4[])
member.summary: Orthogonalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthogonalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthogonalize.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other. This means that any given vector in the list will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector4.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector4[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector4[])
member.summary: Orthonormalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthonormalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthonormalize.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other and making all vectors of unit length. This means that any given vector will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.ACTIVATE_FRONTEND_MENU
member.summary: Does stuff like this: gyazo.com/7fcb78ea3520e3dbc5b2c0c0f3712617 Example: int GetHash = GET_HASH_KEY("fe_menu_version_corona_lobby"); ACTIVATE_FRONTEND_MENU(GetHash, 0, -1); BOOL p1 is a toggle to define the game in pause. int p2 is unknown but -1 always works, not sure why though. [30/03/2017] ins1de : the int p2 is actually a component variable. When the pause menu is visible, it opens the tab related to it. Example : Function.Call(Hash.ACTIVATE_FRONTEND_MENU,-1171018317, 0, 42); Result : Opens the "Online" tab without pausing the menu, with -1 it opens the map.

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.ADD_LINE_TO_CONVERSATION
member.summary: NOTE: ones that are -1, 0 - 35 are determined by a function where it gets a TextLabel from a global then runs, _GET_TEXT_SUBSTRING and depending on what the result is it goes in check order of 0 - 9 then A - Z then z (lowercase). So it will then return 0 - 35 or -1 if it's 'z'. The func to handle that ^^ is func_67 in dialog_handler.c atleast in TU27 Xbox360 scripts. p0 is -1, 0 p1 is a char or string (whatever you wanna call it) p2 is Global 10597 + i * 6. 'i' is a while(i < 70) loop p3 is again -1, 0 - 35 p4 is again -1, 0 - 35 p5 is either 0 or 1 (bool ?) p6 is either 0 or 1 (The func to determine this is bool) p7 is either 0 or 1 (The func to determine this is bool) p8 is either 0 or 1 (The func to determine this is bool) p9 is 0 - 3 (Determined by func_60 in dialogue_handler.c) p10 is either 0 or 1 (The func to determine this is bool) p11 is either 0 or 1 (The func to determine this is bool) p12 is unknown as in TU27 X360 scripts it only goes to p11.

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.ADD_ROPE
member.summary: Creates a rope at the specific position, that extends in the specified direction when not attached to any entities. __ Add_Rope(pos.x,pos.y,pos.z,0.0,0.0,0.0,20.0,4,20.0,1.0,0.0,false,false,false,5.0,false,NULL) When attached, Position<vector> does not matter When attached, Angle<vector> does not matter Rope Type: 4 and bellow is a thick rope 5 and up are small metal wires 0 crashes the game Max_length - Rope is forced to this length, generally best to keep this the same as your rope length. Rigid - If max length is zero, and this is set to false the rope will become rigid (it will force a specific distance, what ever length is, between the objects). breakable - Whether or not shooting the rope will break it. unkPtr - unknown ptr, always 0 in orig scripts __ Lengths can be calculated like so: float distance = abs(x1 - x2) + abs(y1 - y2) + abs(z1 - z2); // Rope length NOTES: Rope does NOT interact with anything you attach it to, in some cases it make interact with the world AFTER it breaks (seems to occur if you set the type to -1). Rope will sometimes contract and fall to the ground like you'd expect it to, but since it doesn't interact with the world the effect is just jaring.

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.APPLY_FORCE_TO_ENTITY
member.summary: Documented here: gtaforums.com/topic/885669-precisely-define-object-physics/ gtaforums.com/topic/887362-apply-forces-and-momentums-to-entityobject/ forceFlags: First bit (lowest): Strong force flag, factor 100 Second bit: Unkown flag Third bit: Momentum flag=1 (vector (x,y,z) is a momentum, more research needed) If higher bits are unequal 0 the function doesn't applay any forces at all. (As integer possible values are 0-7) 0: weak force 1: strong force 2: same as 0 (2nd bit?) 3: same as 1 4: weak momentum 5: strong momentum 6: same as 4 7: same as 5 isDirectionRel: vector defined in local (body-fixed) coordinate frame isForceRel: if true the force gets multiplied with the objects mass (this is why it was known as highForce) and different objects will have the same acceleration.

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.ATTACH_ENTITY_TO_ENTITY
member.summary: Attaches entity1 to bone (boneIndex) of entity2. boneIndex - this is different to boneID, use GET_PED_BONE_INDEX to get the index from the ID. use the index for attaching to specific bones. entity1 will be attached to entity2's centre if bone index given doesn't correspond to bone indexes for that entity type. useSoftPinning - when 2 entities with collision collide and form into a ball they will break the attachment of the entity that they were attached to. Or when an entity is attached far away and then the resets. collision - controls collision between the two entities (FALSE disables collision). isPed - pitch doesnt work when false and roll will only work on negative numbers (only peds) vertexIndex - position of vertex fixedRot - if false it ignores entity vector

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.ATTACH_ENTITY_TO_ENTITY_PHYSICALLY
member.summary: breakForce is the amount of force required to break the bond. fixedRot - if false it ignores entity vector p15 - is 1 or 0 in scripts - unknoun what it does collision - controls collision between the two entities (FALSE disables collision). teleport - do not teleport entity to be attached to the position of the bone Index of the target entity (if 1, entity will not be teleported to target bone) p18 - is always 2 in scripts. ------------------------- teleport is not exactly "doNotTeleport". What it actually does is the following: if true, entities will be attached as if loosely tethered, up to the maximum offset position specified. Almost as if attached by an invisible rope. if false, entities will be attached in a fixed position as specified in the offset position. When p15 = true, it seems to force teleport to false. It also lets the Rotation params actually work.

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.CHANGE_PLAYER_PED
member.summary:
b2 and/or b3 maybe got something to do with keeping values from the last ped. Both of them set to 1 works great.

Examples from the decompiled scripts:

PLAYER::CHANGE_PLAYER_PED(PLAYER::PLAYER_ID(), l_5C0[4 -- [[14]] ], 0, 1);
PLAYER::CHANGE_PLAYER_PED(PLAYER::PLAYER_ID(), a_0[a_0._f7 -- [[1]] ], a_2, 0);


===========================================================
The only way I ever got this to work in GTA Online once is by setting both to 0, 0. However, when you switch from your online character to whomever, your character will start walking away 'as if you left the game.' If from there you attempt to call this native once more to switch back to you online ped. You will freeze or if you try changing to another ped. I've tried all posibilities so far.
1, 1 (Freeze), 0, 0(Works Once), 1, 0 & 0, 1 (Freeze). Note of course trying to call this on another online player will crash. Anyone have any idea if implementing a blr within the xex itself on a possible check if it would prevent this freezing?
===========================================================

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.COMPARE_STRINGS
member.summary: Compares two strings up to a specified number of characters. Parameters: str1 - String to be compared. str2 - String to be compared. matchCase - Comparison will be case-sensitive. maxLength - Maximum number of characters to compare. A value of -1 indicates an infinite length. Returns: A value indicating the relationship between the strings: <0 - The first non-matching character in 'str1' is less than the one in 'str2'. (e.g. 'A' < 'B', so result = -1) 0 - The contents of both strings are equal. >0 - The first non-matching character in 'str1' is less than the one in 'str2'. (e.g. 'B' > 'A', so result = 1) Examples: GAMEPLAY::COMPARE_STRINGS("STRING", "string", false, -1); // 0; equal GAMEPLAY::COMPARE_STRINGS("TESTING", "test", false, 4); // 0; equal GAMEPLAY::COMPARE_STRINGS("R2D2", "R2xx", false, 2); // 0; equal GAMEPLAY::COMPARE_STRINGS("foo", "bar", false, -1); // 4; 'f' > 'b' GAMEPLAY::COMPARE_STRINGS("A", "A", true, 1); // 0; equal When comparing case-sensitive strings, lower-case characters are greater than upper-case characters: GAMEPLAY::COMPARE_STRINGS("A", "a", true, 1); // -1; 'A' < 'a' GAMEPLAY::COMPARE_STRINGS("a", "A", true, 1); // 1; 'a' > 'A'
